mdRecord.dcterms:title: Versailles Gardens and Park, general view

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Versailles Park: view back to palace

In the 1630s Jacques Boyceau and Jacques de Nemours begin work on the garden; however, in 1661 when Louis XIV hired Le Vau to enlarge the building Le Notre was employed on the gardens. Le Brun was responsible for sculptural program. (Grove Dictionary of Art) [work]
